content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: ARMCD
      operator: non_empty
    - name: ARMCD
      operator: is_not_contained_by
      value: $ta_armcd
Operations:
  - domain: TA
    id: $ta_armcd
    name: ARMCD
    operator: distinct
Core:
  Id: CORE-000210
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: When study does not use multi-stage arm assignments and ARMCD is populated,
  ARMCD must be present in TA.ARMCD. This rule has been executed to identify all cases
  when ARMCD is not present in TA.ARMCD and therefore acknowledges that false positives
  may be recorded when multi-stage arm assignments are in use.
Outcome:
  Message: ARMCD is not present in TA.ARMCD
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0516
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: With the exception of studies which use multi-stage
                  Arm assignments, must be a value of ARMCD in the Trial Arms Dataset.  If
                  the subject was not assigned to an Arm, ARMCD is null and ARMNRS
                  is populated
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Specification
                Section: '5.2'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - SPECIAL-PURPOSE
  Domains:
    Include:
      - DM

json.Description: When study does not use multi-stage arm assignments and ARMCD is populated, ARMCD must be present in TA.ARMCD. This rule has been executed to identify all cases when ARMCD is not present in TA.ARMCD and therefore acknowledges that false positives may be recorded when multi-stage arm assignments are in use.

Outcome.Message: ARMCD is not present in TA.ARMCD

Citations.Cited_Guidance: With the exception of studies which use multi-stage Arm assignments, must be a value of ARMCD in the Trial Arms Dataset.  If the subject was not assigned to an Arm, ARMCD is null and ARMNRS is populated
